channel.title: Dan's Data
channel.description: New and interesting computer hardware, gadgets and toys reviewed. And letters. Lots of letters.

item.title: Ultrasone HFI-650 headphones
item.description: They look like the 550s, they feel like the 550s, they've got marketing buzzwords like the 550s - are they worth the extra money?

item.title: Atomic I/O letters column #43
item.description: One switch for everything, shiny shiny heat sinks, the continuing mystery of slack, booting from a postage stamp, and unsuccessful attempts to inebriate hi-fi equipment.

item.title: Batterylife Activator
item.description: Can a sticker rejuvenate your batteries?

item.title: Wanted: Cheap giant bit barrel
item.description: Cheap bulk network storage is possible. Won't someone make it easier?

item.title: Inside your PSU
item.description: What do all of those widgets inside your power supply DO, anyway?

item.title: Ultrasone HFI-550 headphones
item.description: Fine sealed headphones for the money - just don't believe the hype.

item.title: To SLI or not to SLI
item.description: In which I go searching for the truth about new-style SLI, and find a lovely CPU by accident.

item.title: Dan's Data Letters #142
item.description: Laptop noise suppression, tacho wire repurposing, external drive options, centralised DC power, and the Book of the Dead (Groovy!).

item.title: Atomic I/O letters column #42
item.description: Upgrading for Doom, Peltiers redux, thermal goop versus carpet, and the beauty of black heat sinks.

item.title: Dan's Data Letters #141
item.description: E-Vectra PSUs, gold plated photons, long thin proto-board, key remapping, brass monkey photography, UV LEDs, silly graphs, and more fools and scams.

item.title: Mobiblu DAH-220 MP3 player
item.description: The best cassette-shaped MP3 player ever!

item.title: Silverstone LC11 HTPC case
item.description: A slimline enclosure with room for a real PC!

item.title: Hatin' on lithium ion
item.description: Everybody uses 'em, but they're waiting to give you a nasty surprise.

item.title: SilverStone TJ06 computer case
item.description: The most BTX-ish ATX case yet created.

item.title: Dell Inspiron 9200 laptop computer
item.description: Want a 17 inch laptop that doesn't cost a fortune? This is about as close as you'll come.
